metadata.title: CVE-2015-2155 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The force printer in tcpdump before 4.7.2 allows remote attackers to causea denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code viaunspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2155` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpdump - 4.5.1-2ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tcpdump package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.5.1-2ubuntu1.2').
